bibl.title: 'Brother-Sister' Marriage in Roman Egypt: A Curiosity of Humankind or a Widespread Family Strategy?
bibl.note: I. Introduction. - II. Adoption in fourth-century Athens. - III. Adoption praxis in the Graeco-Roman East in later periods. - IV. Adoption in Graeco-Roman Egypt. - V. Brother-sister marriage. - VI. Half-sibling marriage. - VII. The period after A.D. 212. - VIII. Conclusion.
bibl.seg: HUEBNER Sabine R., 'Brother-Sister' Marriage in Roman Egypt: A Curiosity of Humankind or a Widespread Family Strategy?
